    {
      "turn": 1,
      "type": "agent_response",
      "content": "I'm the Control Plane Admin Agent - a read-only assistant for exploring the governance system.\n\n**System status:** 5 packages installed, health: ISSUES DETECTED\n\n**Try these queries:**\n- \"Explain FMWK-000\" - Learn about a framework\n- \"What packages are installed?\" - List all packages\n- \"Check system health\" - Verify system integrity\n- \"Show me the ledger\" - View recent activity\n- \"Read lib/auth.py\" - View file contents\n\nHow can I help you?",

    {
      "turn": 1,
      "type": "user_query",
      "content": "What is the Control Plane?",
      "timestamp": "2026-02-05T06:53:09.722920+00:00",
      "status": null
    },
    {
      "turn": 1,
      "type": "agent_response",
      "content": "Based on my exploration of the Control Plane filesystem, I can now provide you with a comprehensive explanation of what the Control Plane is:\n\n# What is the Control Plane?\n\nThe **Control Plane** is a sophisticated governance and execution framework for managing AI agents and software components in a highly controlled, secure environment. It's designed as a multi-tiered system that enforces strict governance, security, and change management protocols.\n\n## Core Architecture\n\n### **Three-Tier Hierarchy (HO3 \u2192 HO2 \u2192 HO1)**\nThe Control Plane operates on a three-tier privilege model:\n\n- **HO3 (Highest Tier)**: The root plane with maximum privileges that cannot be modified by lower tiers\n- **HO2 (Middle Tier)**: Can reference HO3 interfaces in read-only mode\n- **HO1 (Lowest Tier)**: Can reference both HO2 and HO3 interfaces in read-only mode\n\nLocated at: `/Users/raymondbruni/Brain_Garden/playground/Control_Plane_v2`\n\n### **Key Components**\n\n1. **Governance Framework** - Defines non-negotiable invariants and security posture\n2. **Package Management** - All components must be installed via package manager\n3. **Work Order System** - Controlled change management with human approval gates\n4. **Ledger Protocol** - Comprehensive audit trail of all operations\n5. **Security Gates** - Six validation and application gates (G0-G6) that all changes must pass\n6. **Registry System** - Tracks ownership and relationships between files, specs, and frameworks\n\n## **Key Directories**\n\n- `frameworks/` - Governance standards and protocols\n- `specs/` - Technical specifications for components\n- `packages/` - Installable software packages\n- `ledger/` - Audit trails and execution logs\n- `planes/` - Multi-tier workspace structure\n- `policies/` - Security and operational policies\n- `registries/` - Component ownership and relationship tracking\n\n## **Security Model**\n\nThe Control Plane enforces a **fail-closed** security posture with:\n- No execution outside isolated workspaces\n- No partial state writes\n- Mandatory human approval for work orders\n- Atomic operations with full ledger tracking\n- File ownership verification (no orphan files allowed)\n- Idempotent work order execution\n\n## **Purpose**\n\nThe Control Plane serves as a **governance layer for AI agent development and deployment**, ensuring that:\n1. All changes are tracked and auditable\n2. Components are properly isolated and secured\n3. Dependencies are managed and verified\n4. Human oversight is maintained for critical operations\n5. The system maintains integrity across multiple privilege tiers\n\nThis is essentially a **DevOps and governance framework specifically designed for AI systems**, providing the controls needed to safely develop, test, and deploy AI agents while maintaining security, auditability, and change control.",
      "timestamp": "2026-02-05T06:53:43.367435+00:00",
      "status": "ok"
    },
    {
      "turn": 1,
      "type": "agent_turn",
      "content": "",
      "timestamp": "2026-02-05T06:53:43.370480+00:00",
      "status": "ok"
    },
    {
      "turn": 1,
      "type": "user_query",
      "content": "What is the Control Plane?",
      "timestamp": "2026-02-06T01:25:47.892866+00:00",
      "status": null
    },
    {
      "turn": 1,
      "type": "agent_response",
      "content": "Based on my exploration of the Control Plane structure and documentation, here's what the Control Plane is:\n\n# The Control Plane\n\nThe **Control Plane** is a sophisticated governance system for managing AI agents, code changes, and system operations in a highly structured and secure way. Think of it as an \"operating system for AI systems\" that enforces strict governance, traceability, and safety protocols.\n\n## Key Characteristics\n\n### \ud83c\udfdb\ufe0f **Governance-First Architecture**\n- Every file, component, and change is governed by frameworks and specifications\n- Strict ownership model - every filename must be mapped exactly once to a specification\n- Fail-closed security posture - all gate failures stop execution completely\n\n### \ud83d\udd12 **Security & Isolation**\n- All execution occurs in isolated workspaces\n- No partial state writes to the authoritative plane\n- Human approval gates required for all work orders\n- Multi-gate validation system (G0-G6) for all changes\n\n### \ud83d\udcca **Comprehensive Ledger System**\n- Everything is logged in JSONL ledgers for full traceability\n- Separate ledgers for work orders, execution, and evidence\n- Session-based tracking with unique identifiers\n\n### \ud83c\udfaf **Tiered Operations**\nThe system operates in **planes** (ho1, ho2, etc.) representing different operational tiers:\n- **ho1**: Lower altitude operations\n- **ho2**: Higher altitude operations  \n- Each plane maintains its own sessions and ledgers\n\n## Core Components\n\n| Directory | Purpose |\n|-----------|---------|\n| **frameworks/** | Governance standards (FMWK-*) |\n| **specs/** | Detailed specifications (SPEC-*) |\n| **packages/** | Installable components (PKG-*) |\n| **planes/** | Operational tiers with sessions |\n| **ledger/** | Global transaction logs |\n| **registries/** | Component registration |\n| **policies/** | Enforcement rules |\n\n## What Makes It Special\n\n1. **Agent Governance**: AI agents operate WITHIN the governance model, not outside it\n2. **Immutable Audit Trail**: Every action is logged and traceable\n3. **Package Management**: All components installed via governed package manager\n4. **Work Order Protocol**: All changes must go through approval workflows\n5. **Multi-Gate Validation**: 7-gate system ensures safety and compliance\n\nThe Control Plane essentially creates a \"constitutional framework\" for AI systems - ensuring they operate safely, predictably, and with full accountability while maintaining the flexibility to evolve through governed processes.\n\nThis is version 2.0 of the system, representing a mature, production-ready governance framework for AI operations.",
      "timestamp": "2026-02-06T01:26:22.753088+00:00",
      "status": "ok"
    },
    {
      "turn": 1,
      "type": "agent_turn",
      "content": "",
      "timestamp": "2026-02-06T01:26:22.754276+00:00",
      "status": "ok"
    },
    {
      "turn": 1,
      "type": "user_query",
      "content": "What is the Control Plane?",
      "timestamp": "2026-02-06T01:27:11.353718+00:00",
      "status": null
    },
    {
      "turn": 1,
      "type": "agent_response",
      "content": "Based on my exploration of the Control Plane filesystem, I can provide you with a comprehensive explanation of what the Control Plane is:\n\n# The Control Plane\n\nThe **Control Plane** is a **sophisticated governance and orchestration system** designed to manage the development, deployment, and operation of AI agents in a secure, traceable, and standardized manner. It's essentially a \"system that governs systems\" - providing infrastructure for building, validating, and deploying governed AI agents.\n\n## \ud83c\udfd7\ufe0f **System Architecture**\n\n### **Multi-Tier Structure**\nThe Control Plane uses an **altitude-based architecture** with different tiers (planes):\n- **ho1**, **ho2** (Hand-Over planes) - Different levels of operation\n- Each plane maintains its own isolated environment with dedicated:\n  - **Sessions** - Individual execution contexts\n  - **Ledgers** - Audit trails and execution logs\n  - **Installed packages** - Governed components\n  - **Configuration** - Plane-specific settings\n\n### **Core Components**\n\n1. **\ud83d\udccb Governance Framework** (`FMWK-000`)\n   - Root framework that defines **non-negotiable invariants**\n   - Enforces fail-closed security posture\n   - Requires human approval for all changes\n   - Manages file ownership and work order protocols\n\n2. **\ud83d\udce6 Package Management** \n   - All components must be installed via package manager\n   - Packages stored in `packages_store/` and tracked in registries\n   - Exception: Only `genesis_bootstrap.py` can exist without governance\n\n3. **\ud83d\udcca Ledger System** \n   - **Multiple ledger types**: governance, packages, LLM interactions, kernel operations\n   - **Audit trails** for all system operations\n   - **Session-specific ledgers** for execution tracking\n   - **Evidence ledgers** for compliance and traceability\n\n4. **\ud83d\udee1\ufe0f Gate System**\n   - **Required gates** (G0-G6) that all changes must pass:\n     - G0: OWNERSHIP validation\n     - G1: CHAIN validation  \n     - G2: WORK_ORDER approval\n     - G3: CONSTRAINTS checking\n     - G4: ACCEPTANCE testing\n     - G5: SIGNATURE verification\n     - G6: LEDGER atomic write\n\n## \ud83c\udfaf **Purpose & Capabilities**\n\n### **What it Does:**\n- **Governs AI agent development** through standardized frameworks\n- **Enforces security policies** with fail-closed execution\n- **Tracks all operations** through comprehensive ledger system  \n- **Manages dependencies** and package installations\n- **Validates changes** through multi-gate approval process\n- **Provides isolation** via workspace and session management\n- **Enables traceability** of all system operations\n\n### **Current Agents:**\n- **Admin Agent** (`PKG-T3-ADMIN-001`) - System explanation and health monitoring\n- **Router Agent** - Request routing and classification  \n- **Chat Interface** - Human interaction layer\n\n## \ud83d\udcc1 **Filesystem Structure**\n\n```\nControl_Plane_v2/\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 planes/              # Multi-tier execution environments\n\u2502   \u251c\u2500\u2500 ho1/            # Hand-Over plane 1\n\u2502   \u2514\u2500\u2500 ho2/            # Hand-Over plane 2  \n\u251c\u2500\u2500 frameworks/         # Governance standards and protocols\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 specs/             # Technical specifications for components\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 ledger/           # Global audit trails and logs\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 packages/         # Installable components and modules  \n\u251c\u2500\u2500 registries/       # Component ownership and metadata\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 schemas/          # Data validation schemas\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 policies/         # Security and operational policies\n\u2514\u2500\u2500 work_orders/      # Change management and approvals\n```\n\n## \ud83d\udd12 **Security Model**\n\n- **Fail-closed**: All gate failures stop execution\n- **Isolation**: Execution in dedicated workspaces only\n- **Human approval**: Required for all work orders\n- **No partial state**: Atomic operations only  \n- **Comprehensive logging**: All operations tracked in ledgers\n\n## \ud83d\ude80 **Key Innovation**\n\nThe Control Plane represents a **\"governed AI development platform\"** where agents are both **artifacts OF the system** and **operators WITHIN it**. This creates a self-improving, auditable, and secure environment for AI agent development and deployment.\n\nThe system is currently in **version 2.0.0** and actively manages multiple frameworks, specifications, packages, and agent sessions with full traceability and governance compliance.",
      "timestamp": "2026-02-06T01:28:02.132824+00:00",
      "status": "ok"
    },
    {

      "type": "agent_turn",
